pr_title: Adding diagnostic in CTL run for higher latency requests

timeline.message: Adding diagnostic for latency breached requests

timeline.bodyText: Isn't that way too high? I would think something around 3 seconds or so (maybe 10 to account for queries/FeedResponses with 1000 items( is a more realistic default threshold?
timeline.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: We have retry policy upto 60 sec during 410s, if we bring it below that , there would be  to extra logging for the expected behavior . So the idea was to capture diagnostics for stuck requests (> 1 min) which bring the throughput to 0 for some time as we have experienced in past. Btw It is configurable , so we can change easily during run time without any extra effort
replies.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText: @simplynaveen20  - I agree to @FabianMeiswinkel 's point here, why are we setting the threshold this high ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

timeline.bodyText:
Could you please use Duration format instead of Milisecond here to be consistent with the existing configuration?
see this duration config:
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/blob/master/sdk/cosmos/azure-cosmos-benchmark/src/main/java/com/azure/cosmos/benchmark/Configuration.java#L129-L130
We will have more time configurations and some can be a few hours. It would be good to use a unified time format everywhere. Duration will be the most suitable format.
timeline.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Duration more suits in scenario like maxRunningTimeDuration, but here we have latency  threshold which will  be in seconds at max.  Integer  thresholdForDiagnosticsInMs is more intuitive here
replies.author: simplynaveen20

replies.bodyText: all the public APIs of the SDK for latency regardless of being a short duration or high duration use duration. same goes for  maxRunningTimeDuration config in the benchmark. Duration can be used for both small and long duration configuration. Please let's be consistent everywhere.
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText: Done, only concern was if we choose to set it under one sec then we have to pass in decimal like PT0.010S.
replies.author: simplynaveen20

timeline.bodyText:
StopWatch can be accessed on different threads and it is not thread safe.
Please use a volatile long for measuring the checkpoint.
private long startTimeInMs
timeline.author: moderakh
moderakh

replies.bodyText: Wow - thanks - I would never have imagined StopWatch to not be thread-safe in Java
replies.author: FabianMeiswinkel

replies.bodyText: Done , moved to volatile long startTimeInMs , but we could have done with StopWatch with synchronous block as we are doing in gone and retry policy. Also we are creating new subscriber every time and not sharing with other request , so not sure we would have the threading problem here. Any way I am fine either way
replies.author: simplynaveen20
